roleset.name: equal

role.descr: focus, one side of equation or equal things in one mention
other side of equation when separate mention
attribute, quality in which args are equal

example.name: equivalent-j
example.text: This is equivalent to a working person earning L 35,000 .
example.arg: to a working person earning L 35,000 .

example.name: equivalent-j: Equivalent things in one mention, with attribute
example.text: They are equivalent in function, though the compilers I tested (Java 1.6.0_07 and Eclipse 3.4) generate different bytecode.
example.arg: though the compilers I tested (Java 1.6.0_07 and Eclipse 3.4) generate different bytecode.

example.name: equivalency-n
example.text: CAD equivalency with hyperlipidemia , hypertension , and dysmetabolic syndrome
example.arg: with hyperlipidemia , hypertension , and dysmetabolic syndrome
example.THYME-AMR: (e / equivalent-01 :ARG1 (a / and :op1 (d2 / disease-disorder :name (n2 / name :op1 "hyperlipidemia")) :op2 (d3 / disease-disorder :name (n3 / name :op1 "hypertension")) :op3 (d4 / disease-disorder :name (n4 / name :op1 "dysmetabolic" :op2 "syndrome"))) :ARG2 (d / disease-disorder :name (n / name :op1 "CAD")))

roleset.note: EQUIVALENT-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire. Comparison to equal-v, equal-j.01. (from equivalent.01-j)
